Paragraph.Text: the vehicle identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the GVWR, expressed in kilograms, intended for the vehicle when it is a completed vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the GAWR, expressed in kilograms, intended for each axle of the vehicle when it is a completed vehicle, listed in order from front to rear, except that the GAWR for consecutive axles that have identical GAWRs when equipped with tires that have the same designated tire size may be stated once followed by the words “each” and “chacun”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the types of vehicles referred to in paragraph 6(1)(f) into which the incomplete vehicle is designed to be manufactured; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the numbers of the prescribed standards that apply, at the date specified in paragraph (b), in respect of each type of vehicle listed, followed in each case by one or more of the following statements, as applicable:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that the completed vehicle will conform to the standard if no alterations are made to the components of the incomplete vehicle that are identified by the incomplete vehicle manufacturer (for example, CMVSS 104 — This vehicle, when completed, will conform to Standard 104, Windshield Wiping and Washing System, if no alterations are made to the windshield or the windshield wiping and washing system),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that the completed vehicle will conform to the standard if the vehicle is manufactured in accordance with the conditions specified by the incomplete vehicle manufacturer (for example, CMVSS 121 — This vehicle, when completed, will conform to Standard 121, Air Brake Systems, if it does not exceed any of the GAWRs, if the centre of gravity at GVWR is not higher than 2.75 m above the ground and if no alterations are made in any brake system component), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that conformity to the standard cannot be determined based upon the components that are fitted on the incomplete vehicle and that the incomplete vehicle manufacturer makes no representation as to conformity with the standard.

Subsection.Text: The document shall be kept in a weather-resistant container that is attached to the vehicle in a conspicuous and readily accessible location, or it may be sent directly to an intermediate manufacturer, a final-stage manufacturer or other purchaser, as the case may be.
Every incomplete vehicle manufacturer shall apply to every incomplete vehicle it manufactures an information label that displays the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, in both official languages, that the vehicle is an incomplete vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the incomplete vehicle manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the month and year the incomplete vehicle manufacturer performed its last manufacturing operation on the incomplete vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the vehicle identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the GVWR intended for the vehicle when it is a completed vehicle, expressed in kilograms, clearly identified by the words “Gross Vehicle Weight Rating” and “Poids nominal brut du véhicule” or the abbreviations “GVWR” and “PNBV”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the GAWR, expressed in kilograms, intended for each axle of the vehicle when it is a completed vehicle, listed in order from front to rear and clearly identified by the words “Gross Axle Weight Ratings” and “Poids nominal brut sur l’essieu” or the abbreviations “GAWR” and “PNBE”, except that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the GAWR for consecutive axles that have identical GAWRs when equipped with tires that have the same designated tire size may be stated once followed by the words “each” and “chacun”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information need not appear on the label if it is set out on the vehicle placard or the tire inflation pressure label referred to in section S4.3 of Technical Standards Document No. 110, Tire Selection and Rims for Motor Vehicles With a GVWR of 4,536 kg or Less, or on the tire information label referred to in section S5.3(b) of Technical Standards Document No. 120, Tire Selection and Rims for Motor Vehicles With a GVWR of More Than 4,536 kg; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a vehicle manufactured in Canada for sale in Canada, a drawing of at least 20 mm in diameter depicting the national safety mark set out in Schedule I and showing in its centre, in figures of at least 2 mm in height, the authorization number assigned by the Minister to the company under section 3.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), the information label shall be applied

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to the hinge pillar, door latch post or the door edge that meets the door latch post next to the driver’s seating position;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the left side of the instrument panel or the inward-facing surface of the door next to the driver’s seating position, if it is impracticable to apply the label in accordance with paragraph (a); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to a conspicuous and readily accessible location, if it is impracticable to apply the label in accordance with paragraph (a) or (b) or if the vehicle does not have the components described in paragraph (a) or (b).

Subsection.Text: In the case of a stripped or cowl chassis, the information label may be applied to a conspicuous and readily accessible location on the steering column.
The drawing referred to in paragraph (1)(g) may be displayed on a label applied to the vehicle beside the incomplete vehicle manufacturer’s information label.

Every intermediate manufacturer of an incomplete vehicle shall, at or before the time of delivery of the incomplete vehicle to the subsequent manufacturer, provide to the subsequent manufacturer, in the manner specified in subsection 6.1(2), the incomplete vehicle document that was provided by the previous manufacturer.
An intermediate manufacturer shall, before complying with subsection (1), make an addendum to the incomplete vehicle document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its name and mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a clear and precise description of all the changes it has made to the incomplete vehicle; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if any of the changes affect the validity of a statement made by the incomplete vehicle manufacturer in accordance with paragraph 6.1(1)(g), an indication of the amendments that must be made to those statements to reflect the changes made by the intermediate manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), an intermediate manufacturer shall apply to every incomplete vehicle, beside the information label of the previous manufacturer, an information label that displays the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, in both official languages, that the vehicle is an incomplete vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the intermediate manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, in both official languages, that the company is an intermediate manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the month and year in which the intermediate manufacturer performed its last manufacturing operation on the incomplete vehicle; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a vehicle manufactured in Canada for sale in Canada, a drawing of at least 20 mm in diameter depicting the national safety mark set out in Schedule I and showing in its centre, in figures of at least 2 mm in height, the authorization number assigned by the Minister to the company under section 3.

Subsection.Text: The drawing referred to in paragraph (1)(e) may be displayed on a label applied to the vehicle beside the intermediate manufacturer’s information label.
If the information label applied to an incomplete vehicle by the previous manufacturer is not in a location described in paragraph 6.2(2)(a) or (b),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information label shall be applied in a location specified in paragraph 6.2(2)(a) or (b), or in a conspicuous and readily accessible location if it is impracticable to conform to paragraph 6.2(2)(a) or (b); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (4), the information label shall display the GVWR and GAWRs set out on the label applied by the previous manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: If an intermediate manufacturer increases the GVWR or the GAWRs above those referred to in paragraphs 6.1(1)(d) and (e), the intermediate manufacturer shall ensure that the new ratings are displayed on that intermediate manufacturer’s information label and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: are increased in accordance with the written recommendations of the incomplete vehicle manufacturer or, if applicable, of another previous manufacturer; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are within the load-carrying capacity of the vehicle’s components when the vehicle is loaded for its intended use as a completed vehicle.

Subsection.Text: A final-stage manufacturer shall make an addendum to the incomplete vehicle document that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its name and mailing address; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a clear and precise description of all the changes that it has made to the incomplete vehicle.

Subsection.Text: The final-stage manufacturer shall retain and make available to the Minister, on request, the incomplete vehicle documentation referred to in subsection (1) and sections 6.1 and 6.3, for a period of no less than five years after the date manufacturing operations on the vehicle are completed by the final-stage manufacturer.

Every final-stage manufacturer shall choose a date of manufacture for a completed vehicle that may be no earlier than the date specified by the incomplete vehicle manufacturer on its information label but no later than the date manufacturing operations on the vehicle are completed by the final-stage manufacturer and shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: complete the incomplete vehicle in such a manner that the completed vehicle conforms to the standards prescribed for a completed vehicle of that class as of the date chosen by the final-stage manufacturer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: apply to the completed vehicle a compliance label in accordance with section 6, except that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of manufacture referred to in paragraph 6(1)(b) is the date of manufacture chosen by the final-stage manufacturer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), the GVWR and GAWRs shall be those set out on the label applied by the previous manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: If a final-stage manufacturer increases the GVWR or the GAWRs above those referred to in paragraphs 6.1(1)(d) and (e) and subsection 6.4(4) or new ratings have been displayed on an intermediate manufacturer’s information label, the final-stage manufacturer shall ensure that the new ratings are displayed on the compliance label for the completed vehicle and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: are increased in accordance with the written recommendations of the incomplete vehicle manufacturer or, if applicable, of another previous manufacturer; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are within the load-carrying capacity of the vehicle’s components when the vehicle is loaded for its intended use as a completed vehicle.

Section.Text: All the labels applied to a vehicle under sections 6, 6.2, 6.4 and 6.6 shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be permanently attached to the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be resistant to or protected against any weather condition to which the label may be exposed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: have lettering that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: clear and indelible,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: indented, embossed or in a colour that contrasts with the background colour of the label, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in block capitals and numerals not less than 2 mm in height; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: have metric units identified by the appropriate name or symbol.

Subsection.Text: If a company alters a vehicle, other than an incomplete vehicle or a truck tractor not fitted with a fifth wheel coupling, that was in conformity with these Regulations in such a manner that its stated GVWR and GAWR are no longer accurate, or if the company alters the vehicle otherwise than by the addition, substitution or removal of readily attachable components such as mirrors or tire and rim assemblies or by minor finishing operations, the company shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the compliance label and information label, if applicable, remain on the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: respect the gross axle weight ratings and gross vehicle weight rating of the vehicle recommended by the original manufacturer or, where the company increases the ratings, ensure that they are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: increased in accordance with the original manufacturer’s written recommendations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: within the load-carrying capacity of the vehicle’s components when the altered vehicle is loaded for its intended use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the vehicle conforms to the standards referred to in subsection 5(2), in respect of the work carried out by the company to alter the vehicle; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), apply to the vehicle an additional label displaying

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the words “THIS VEHICLE WAS ALTERED BY / CE VÉHICULE A ÉTÉ MODIFIÉ PAR” followed by the name of the company that altered the vehicle,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the month and year during which the alteration of the vehicle was completed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drawing referred to in paragraph 6(1)(c),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with paragraph 6(1)(e), the new gross vehicle weight rating and gross axle weight ratings of the vehicle as altered, where they differ from those shown on the original compliance label,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with paragraph 6(1)(f), the type of vehicle, where it differs from the type shown on the original compliance label, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a multi-purpose passenger vehicle or bus manufactured from a cutaway chassis, a motor home or a recreational trailer, the information referred to in subsection 6(8).

Subsection.Text: The drawing referred to in paragraph (1)(c) may be displayed on a label applied to the vehicle beside the compliance label.

In the case of a motor home or a recreational trailer, the information referred to in subparagraph (1)(c)(vi) may be displayed on a separate label applied to the vehicle beside the compliance label or in a conspicuous or readily accessible location.

For each vehicle to which the national safety mark is applied or that is imported into Canada, a company shall maintain in writing or in readily readable electronic or optical form the records referred to in paragraph 5(1)(g) of the Act that show that the vehicle conforms to all prescribed standards applicable to it and retain those records for at least five years after the date of manufacture or importation.
If the records referred to in subsection (1) are maintained by a person on behalf of a company, the company shall keep the name and address of that person.
On request in writing from an inspector, a company shall send to that inspector a copy, in either official language, of the records referred to in subsection (1) within

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 30 working days after the mailing of the request; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the records must be translated, 45 working days after the mailing of the request.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (4) to (6), any person importing into Canada a vehicle of a prescribed class shall, at the nearest customs office that is open for business, make a declaration, signed by that person or that person’s duly authorized representative, setting out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the company or individual importing the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer of the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date the vehicle is presented for importation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the class, make, model and vehicle identification number of the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the vehicle bears an information label or compliance label, as the case may be, or, where the importer is an individual, a statement from the manufacturer or the duly authorized representative of that manufacturer that the vehicle described in the document conformed to the applicable standards prescribed under these Regulations at the time the main assembly of the vehicle was completed;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that on the date of its importation the vehicle conformed to the applicable standards prescribed under these Regulations at the time the main assembly of the vehicle was completed;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: where the importer is an individual, the month and year the main assembly of the vehicle was completed.

Subsection.Text: The declaration that a person or the person’s duly authorized representative must make prior to importation, pursuant to paragraph 7(1)(a) of the Act, shall be signed and contain the information set out in Schedule VII.
The declarations made in accordance with subsection (2)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be filed with the Minister prior to importation of the vehicle; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a company whose world production of vehicles is 2,500 or more a year, may be filed with the Minister quarterly.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 5(1)(b) of the Act, any company that imports 2,500 vehicles or more a year into Canada may provide the information referred to in subsection (1) in another form and manner that is satisfactory to the Minister.

Any company importing a vehicle into Canada pursuant to subsection 5(3) of the Act shall, at the nearest customs office that is open for business, make a declaration, signed by that person or that person’s duly authorized representative, setting out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the company importing the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the company that completed the main assembly of the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the company that will be completing the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the class, make, model and vehicle identification number of the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date the vehicle is presented for importation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a statement from the company that completed the main assembly of the vehicle that the vehicle, when completed in accordance with the provided instructions, will conform to the applicable standards prescribed under these Regulations at the time the main assembly of the vehicle was completed; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the vehicle will be completed in accordance with the provided instructions.

Subsection.Text: Any person importing a vehicle imported temporarily into Canada for special purposes shall file with the Minister, prior to importation, a declaration signed by the person or the person’s duly authorized representative, containing the information set out in Schedule VII.

Heading.TitleText: Importation of a Vehicle Purchased in the United States

Subsection.Text: The company contracted to the Department of Transport to establish and operate the national program of vehicle inspection, certification and registration, to be known as the registrar of imported vehicles, is the person designated for the purposes of subsection 7(2) of the Act.
Subsection 7(2) of the Act does not apply to a person who is a company referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition company in section 2 of the Act.
For the purposes of subsection 7(2) of the Act, a person may import into Canada a vehicle referred to in that subsection where the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a vehicle other than a restricted-use motorcycle or a snowmobile, the vehicle was manufactured by a company to conform to the applicable United States federal laws on the date of manufacture, as shown on the American compliance labels on the vehicle or on a written statement from each company that manufactured the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a snowmobile, the vehicle was manufactured by a company to conform, on the date of manufacture, to the applicable safety standards of the Snowmobile Safety and Certification Committee, Inc., as shown on the certification label on the snowmobile or on a written statement from the company that manufactured the snowmobile;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any defect in the vehicle’s construction, design or functioning, or in the construction, design or functioning of its components, that was the subject of a notice of defect or nonconformity under United States federal laws was corrected;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an incomplete vehicle, truck, enclosed motorcycle, multi-purpose passenger vehicle, three-wheeled vehicle, passenger car or bus, the vehicle was manufactured by the company that completed the main assembly of the vehicle to conform to section 210 of Schedule IV;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a school bus, the vehicle was manufactured by the company that completed the main assembly of the vehicle to conform to section 222 of Schedule IV;

Paragraph.Label: (d.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a restricted-use motorcycle, the vehicle is designed to travel on two or four wheels;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where the person is importing the vehicle for sale or for any commercial, industrial, occupational, institutional or other like use, the vehicle is imported at a customs office designated in Schedule VIII; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the person registers the vehicle with the registrar of imported vehicles, and makes a declaration, in the manner set out in subsection (6).

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding paragraph (3)(c) a person may import a vehicle that does not comply with section 210 of Schedule IV if, before being certified by the registrar of imported vehicles, the vehicle can be made to conform to that section by changing a seat or the seat tracks for a seat or seat tracks that are used in vehicles of the same make and model that are manufactured for the Canadian market.

For the purposes of subsection 7(2) of the Act, a vehicle that has been sold at the retail level in the United States and that has not been certified by the manufacturer as conforming to subsection 114(4) of Schedule IV to these Regulations may be imported into Canada despite not being certified to conform to subsection 114(4) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the vehicle was fitted at the time of manufacture with an electronic immobilization system; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person importing the vehicle states in their declaration that the vehicle

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: will be fitted with an immobilization system that conforms to National Standard of Canada CAN/ULC-S338-98, entitled Automobile Theft Deterrent Equipment and Systems: Electronic Immobilization (May 1998), published by the Underwriters’ Laboratories of Canada, before it is presented for registration under the laws of a province, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: will be taken, within 45 days after its importation, to an inspection station authorized by the registrar of imported vehicles to carry out an inspection function to determine that the vehicle has been made to conform to the standard.

Subsection.Text: The declaration referred to in paragraph (3)(f) shall be signed by the person importing the vehicle or that person’s duly authorized representative and set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the class, make, model and vehicle identification number of the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date the vehicle is presented for importation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the company or individual importing the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a vehicle other than a restricted-use motorcycle or a snowmobile, where the vehicle bears the compliance labels referred to in paragraph (3)(a), a statement that the vehicle bears those labels and, where required by United States federal laws, the vehicle emission control label applied by the company that manufactured the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (d.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a snowmobile, where the snowmobile bears the certification label referred to in paragraph (3)(a.1), a statement that the vehicle bears that label;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where a vehicle referred to in paragraph (d) does not bear the labels referred to in that paragraph, a statement from each company that manufactured the vehicle or its duly authorized representative that, on the date of manufacture, the vehicle conformed to the applicable United States federal laws;

Paragraph.Label: (e.1)
Paragraph.Text: where a snowmobile does not bear the certification label referred to in paragraph (d.1), a statement from the company that manufactured the vehicle or its duly authorized representative that, on the date of manufacture, the vehicle conformed to the applicable safety standards of the Snowmobile Safety and Certification Committee, Inc.;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: where an American compliance label is applied to the vehicle, the name of the company that manufactured the vehicle, as shown on the label;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the month and year during which the main assembly of the vehicle was completed, as shown on the American compliance label applied to the vehicle or on the statement by the company that completed the main assembly of the vehicle or by its duly authorized representative; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the vehicle will be made to conform to all applicable standards prescribed under these Regulations for that class of vehicle and will be taken, within 45 days after its importation, to an inspection station authorized by the registrar of imported vehicles to carry out an inspection function to determine that a vehicle has been made to conform to the Canada motor vehicle safety standards.

Subsection.Text: A declaration and registration shall be made using the form provided by the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person referred to in paragraph (3)(e), at a designated customs office; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, at the nearest customs office that is open for business.

Subsection.Text: An authorized inspection station shall determine that a vehicle referred to in subsection 7(2) of the Act has been made to conform to the Canada motor vehicle safety standards.

A vehicle that has been determined to conform to the standards prescribed under these Regulations and in respect of which a certificate of conformity has been issued by the registrar of imported vehicles, shall bear a label in both official languages that displays at least the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the company or individual that imported the vehicle, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the company or individual that altered the vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the month and year during which the alteration of the vehicle was completed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that all the necessary alterations have been made to make the vehicle conform to the applicable standards prescribed under these Regulations at the time the main assembly of the vehicle was completed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the vehicle identification number; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a passenger car, truck, multi-purpose passenger vehicle, low-speed vehicle, bus, trailer, trailer converter dolly, motorcycle or three-wheeled vehicle,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the gross vehicle weight rating of the vehicle expressed in kilograms, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the gross axle weight rating for each axle of the vehicle, expressed in kilograms and listed in order from front to rear.

Subsection.Text: The label referred to in subsection (8) shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be permanently applied

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to the same surface as that to which a compliance label referred to in paragraph (3)(a) is applied, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where none of the compliance labels referred to in paragraph (3)(a) is applied to the vehicle, in the appropriate location referred to in subsection 6(3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be resistant to or protected against any weather condition to which the label may be exposed; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: have lettering that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: clear and indelible,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: indented, embossed or in a colour that contrasts with the background colour of the label, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in block capitals and numerals not less than 2 mm in height.

Subsection.Text: Where any compliance label referred to in paragraph (3)(a) is not applied to the vehicle, a statement that indicates that the vehicle was manufactured to conform to the applicable United States federal laws on the date of manufacture shall be displayed on the label referred to in subsection (8) or on a label applied beside that compliance label.
Any company applying for an exemption pursuant to section 9 of the Act shall submit in writing to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its name and address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the province or country under the laws of which it is established;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number, title and text or substance of the standards from which exemption is sought and the duration of that exemption;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for requesting an exemption;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the reasons for withholding from public disclosure any specific part of the information and data found in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons why the granting of the exemption would be in the public interest and consistent with the objectives of the Act.

Subsection.Text: Where the basis of an application for an exemption is substantial financial hardship, the applicant shall include in the submission to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: technical and financial information demonstrating in detail why conformity to the standards referred to in paragraph (1)(c) would create substantial financial hardship, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of each of the items that would have to be altered in order to achieve conformity,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the itemized estimated cost of making the alterations referred to in subparagraph (i)

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: at the end of one year from the date the application is submitted, if the application is for an exemption for one year or more but less than two years,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: at the end of two years from the date the application is submitted, if the application is for an exemption for two years or more but less than three years, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: at the end of three years from the date the application is submitted, if the application is for an exemption for three years,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the estimated price increase per vehicle to counter the total costs incurred pursuant to subparagraph (ii) and a statement of the anticipated effect of each such price increase,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: corporate balance sheets and income statements for the three fiscal years immediately preceding the filing of the application,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a projected balance sheet and income statement for the fiscal year following a denial of the application, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a discussion of any other hardship to be considered; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the applicant’s efforts to conform to the standards from which exemption is sought, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a discussion of other means of conformity that were considered and the reasons for rejecting each of them,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the steps to be taken while the exemption is in effect and the estimated date by which conformity will be achieved through design changes or the termination of the production of non-conforming vehicles,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the world production of vehicles manufactured by the company or by the manufacturer of the model that is the subject of the application in the 12 month period beginning two years before the beginning of the period in respect of which the exemption is applied for, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the total number of vehicles manufactured for, or imported into, the Canadian market in the 12 month period beginning two years before the beginning of the period in respect of which the exemption is applied for.

Subsection.Text: Where the basis of an application for exemption is the development of new safety or emission control features that are equivalent to or superior to those that conform to the prescribed standards, the applicant shall include in the submission to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the new features;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the research, development and testing documentation establishing the innovative nature of the new features;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an analysis of how the level of performance of the new features is equivalent to or superior to the level of performance established by the prescribed standards, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed description of how a vehicle equipped with the new features would, if exempted, differ from one that conforms to the prescribed standards, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the results of tests conducted on the new features that demonstrate a level of performance that is equivalent to or superior to that required by the prescribed standards;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that an exemption would facilitate the development or the field evaluation of the vehicle; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to whether the manufacturer intends, at the end of the exemption period,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to conform to the prescribed standards,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to apply for a further exemption, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: to request that the prescribed standards be amended to incorporate the new features.

Subsection.Text: Where the basis of an application for exemption is the development of new kinds of vehicles, vehicle systems or components, the applicant shall include in the submission to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the research, development and testing documentation establishing that an exemption would not substantially diminish the safe performance of the vehicle, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed description of how the vehicle equipped with the new kinds of vehicle systems or components would, if exempted, differ from one that conforms to the prescribed standards,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the reasons why not conforming to the prescribed standards does not substantially diminish the safe performance of the vehicle, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a discussion of other means of conformity that were considered and the reasons for rejecting each of them;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons why an exemption would facilitate the development or the field evaluation of the vehicle; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to whether the company intends, at the end of the exemption period, the vehicle to conform to the prescribed standards.

Subsection.Text: Where the Governor in Council has made an exemption order pursuant to section 9 of the Act for a model of vehicle, a label shall be securely applied by the company to the windshield or side window of every vehicle of that model, specifying

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the features of the vehicle and the standards, by number and title, in respect of which the exemption has been granted; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the short title of the exemption order.

Subsection.Text: Where a company wishes, on the expiration of the period of an exemption referred to in subsection 13(3), to obtain a new exemption, the company shall submit, in writing, to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information required pursuant to that subsection; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the total number of vehicles sold in Canada under the expiring exemption.

Subsection.Text: Where a company wishes, on the expiration of the period of an exemption referred to in subsection 13(4), to obtain a new exemption, the company shall submit, in writing, to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information required pursuant to that subsection; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the total number of vehicles sold in Canada under the expiring exemption.

Subsection.Text: A notice of defect required to be given under section 10 of the Act shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the company giving the notice of defect;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the prescribed class of each vehicle for which the notice of defect is given, the make, model, model year and vehicle identification number of the vehicle, the period during which it was manufactured and any other information necessary to permit its identification;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the estimated percentage of the vehicles that potentially contain the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an evaluation of the risk to the safety of persons that arises from the defect; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the measures to be taken to correct the defect.

Subsection.Text: The notice of defect shall be given in writing and, when it is to be given to a person other than the Minister, shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in both official languages; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the person’s official language of choice, if it is known.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 10(1) of the Act, the person who obtained the vehicle from the company is a prescribed person.

The notice of defect shall be given to the current owner and to the person who obtained the vehicle from the company as soon as possible after the company becomes aware of the defect, but no later than 60 days after the day on which the company becomes aware of it.

A company shall, within 60 days after the day on which it gives a notice of defect to the Minister under paragraph 10(1)(a) of the Act, submit to the Minister a report containing, in addition to the information required by subsection (1), the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of vehicles for which the notice of defect was given and the number of those vehicles in each prescribed class;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a chronology of the principal events that led to the determination of the existence of the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: copies of all notices, bulletins and other circulars issued by the company in respect of the defect; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the nature of the defect and of its location, with any related diagrams or illustrations.

Subsection.Text: After submitting the report referred to in subsection (5), a company shall, for a period of two years after the day on which it gives the notice of defect to the Minister, submit to the Minister quarterly reports containing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number, title or other identification assigned by the company to the notice of defect;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the revised number of vehicles for which the notice of defect was given, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the dates on which notices of defect were given to the current owners of the affected vehicles; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the total number or percentage of vehicles that had the defect corrected, including vehicles that required only an inspection.

Subsection.Text: Documents that contain motor vehicle safety test methods shall be published by the Department of Transport under the main title Test Method, followed by an identification number, a descriptive title and the publication date.

For the purposes of section 12 of the Act, every technical standards document, including all of the amendments to it, shall be published by the Department of Transport and have the main title Technical Standards Document, followed by an identification number, a descriptive title and the publication date.

Section.Text: The Department of Transport shall publish a notice in the Canada Gazette Part I each time the Department amends a technical standards document.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 5(1)(f) of the Act, for each vehicle that a company imports into Canada before the vehicle is sold to the first retail purchaser and for each vehicle to which a company applies a compliance label, the company shall provide, in written, electronic or optical form, an owner’s manual containing the information required by these Regulations relating to the operation of the vehicle.
The owner’s manual shall be available in both official languages.
If the owner’s manual is available only in electronic or optical form, it shall be capable of being used inside the occupant compartment using a device installed in or supplied with the vehicle.

Heading.TitleText: Controls, Tell-tales, Indicators and Sources of Illumination (Standard 101)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, control has the same meaning as in Technical Standards Document No. 101, Controls, Tell-tales, Indicators and Sources of Illumination (TSD 101).

Every vehicle that is required by section 5 of these Regulations to conform to the standards set out in this section shall, in respect of the controls, tell-tales, indicators and sources of illumination that are fitted in the occupant compartment, conform to the requirements of TSD 101, as amended from time to time.
Despite S5.2.1 of TSD 101,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the left turn signal and the right turn signal each have their own control or tell-tale, the arrows in the symbol required for the turn signals control or tell-tale may be disassociated and each arrow may be used separately as a distinct symbol;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the left turn signal and the right turn signal each have their own tell-tale and the arrows in the symbol required for the turn signals tell-tale are disassociated so that each arrow is used separately as a distinct symbol, the simultaneous flashing of the left and right turn signal tell-tales may be used as the hazard warning signal tell-tale;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the identification of a control set out below is not required if the control is combined with the master lighting switch:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the control for the tail lamps, parking lamps, licence plate lamps, side marker lamps, identification lamps and clearance lamps, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the headlamp lower beam control;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if a single tell-tale is used to indicate more than one brake system condition, only the symbol required for the brake system malfunction shall be used;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the identification of a control set out below is not required if the control is an integral part of the key-locking system of the vehicle:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the engine start control, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the engine stop control;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the identification required for the drive position of the automatic transmission control may be replaced by a letter, a number, a combination of letters and numbers, or any symbol that is not set out in column 2 of the table to this section;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the symbol required for the engine start control may be replaced by the word “start”;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the symbol required for the engine stop control may be replaced by the word “stop”;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the symbol required for the electronic stability control system malfunction tell-tale may be replaced by the abbreviation “ESC”;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the symbol required for the electronic stability control system off control and tell-tale may be replaced by the abbreviation “ESC OFF”; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: until September 1, 2019, the symbol required for the passenger air bag deactivated control and tell-tale may be replaced by the words “passenger air bag off” or “pass air bag off”.

Subsection.Text: A speedometer shall indicate the speed of the vehicle in kilometres per hour or in kilometres per hour and miles per hour. The unit or units of measurement shall be identified on the speedometer or at a location adjacent to it.

A speedometer shall be illuminated whenever the vehicle’s propulsion system and headlamps are activated, unless the headlamps are being flashed for signalling purposes or are being operated as daytime running lamps.

An odometer or trip odometer shall indicate distances in kilometres or in miles. If the distances are indicated in miles, that unit of measurement shall be identified at a location adjacent to the odometer or trip odometer.
The tell-tale indicating that the passenger air bag has been deactivated shall be fitted in the interior of the vehicle

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: forward of and above the seating reference point of each front outboard designated seating position when the seat is in its forwardmost position; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in such a manner that the tell-tale, when alight, is visible to the driver and any front passenger when they are restrained by seat belts that are adjusted in accordance with the vehicle manufacturer’s instructions.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (7), the tell-tale indicating that the passenger air bag has been deactivated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall not be fitted at or adjacent to a location that can serve for storage if an object stored at that location will obstruct the tell-tale from the view of the driver and any front passenger when they are restrained by seat belts that are adjusted in accordance with the vehicle manufacturer’s instructions; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall not be fitted at a location where the tell-tale will not be completely visible to the driver when the driver is restrained by a seat belt that is adjusted in accordance with the vehicle manufacturer’s instructions and a rearward-facing child restraint system or an infant restraint system is installed in the forwardmost right outboard designated seating position.

Subsection.Text: The English and French versions of the owner’s manual shall contain an explanation of every symbol, word, abbreviation or letter used to identify a control, tell-tale or indicator that is fitted in the vehicle and is required to be identified under this section.
Until September 1, 2019, a vehicle referred to in subsection (2) may conform to the requirements of this section as it read on the day before the day on which this subsection came into force.

Subsection.Text: Any automatic transmission fitted on a vehicle shall have

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its control positions in such a sequence that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: movement between any forward and reverse drive position may be made only through a neutral position,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a steering-column-mounted control, movement from the neutral position to any forward drive position may be made in a clockwise direction only, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the park position, if included in the sequence, is located at the end of the sequence adjacent to the reverse drive position; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: one forward drive position that, in vehicles having more than one forward transmission gear ratio, provides a greater degree of engine braking than the highest speed transmission ratio at speeds below 40 km/h.

Subsection.Text: On any vehicle equipped with an automatic transmission, a motor used for the vehicle’s propulsion must not be started by setting the ignition switch to the position used to start the motor if the transmission control is in a forward or reverse drive position.

If a passenger car, multi-purpose passenger vehicle, truck or three-wheeled vehicle has a GVWR of 4 536 kg or less and a transmission control sequence that includes a park position, the transmission control must not be capable of shifting from the park position to the forward or reverse drive position — while a motor used for the vehicle’s propulsion is in use — unless the service brake pedal is depressed or the service brakes are otherwise engaged.

Subject to subsection (5), where the transmission control sequence includes a park position, the identification of the transmission control positions and the position selected shall be displayed in at least a single location in view of the driver when

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ignition switch is set to the position where the transmission can be shifted; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transmission control is not in the park position.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (5), if the transmission control sequence does not include a park position, the identification of the transmission control positions and the position selected shall be displayed in at least a single location in view of the driver when the ignition switch is set to the position where the engine is capable of operation.
The identification of transmission control positions need not be displayed when the ignition switch is set to the position used to start the vehicle.
The identification of the transmission control positions and sequence, on vehicles equipped with a manual transmission, shall be permanently displayed in view of the driver.

If a passenger car, multi-purpose passenger vehicle, truck or three-wheeled vehicle has a GVWR of 4 536 kg or less and is equipped with a manual transmission, a motor used for the vehicle’s propulsion must not be started by setting the ignition switch to the position used to start the motor unless the clutch pedal is depressed or the drive train is otherwise disengaged.
In this section, drive train means the components that transfer motive power from the motor to the drive wheels.
In this section,

Definition.Text: critical area means area C as referred to in section 104 of this Schedule; (zone critique)
defog means to remove moisture from the inside surface of the glass; (désembuer)
defrost means to melt frost or ice on the inside or outside surface of the glass; (dégivrer)
entire windshield means area A as referred to in section 104 of this Schedule; (pare-brise tout entier)

road load means the power output required to move the vehicle at the curb mass plus 180 kg on level, clean, dry, smooth portland cement concrete pavement or other surface with an equivalent coefficient of surface friction at a specified speed through still air at 20°C and a standard barometric pressure of 101.3 kPa, and includes driveline friction, rolling friction and air resistance. (charge de route)

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2.1), every vehicle shall be equipped with a windshield defrosting and defogging system.
A three-wheeled vehicle that is equipped with a windshield shall be equipped with a windshield defrosting and defogging system.
In the case of a passenger car or a three-wheeled vehicle, the windshield defrosting and defogging system shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements of section 3 of SAE Recommended Practice J902 Passenger Car Windshield Defrosting Systems, (August 1964), when tested in accordance with paragraph (b) except that the areas referred to in that section as “critical area” and “entire windshield” shall be as referred to in subsection (1) of this section; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be tested in accordance with such of the portions of paragraphs 4.1 to 4.4.7 of SAE Recommended Practice J902, (August 1964), or SAE Recommended Practice J902a, (March 1967), as are applicable to that system.

Subsection.Text: Despite the testing requirements set out in subsection (3) for the windshield defrosting and defogging system of a passenger car or three-wheeled vehicle,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a passenger car or three-wheeled vehicle equipped with a heating system other than a heat exchanger type that uses the engine’s coolant as a means to supply the heat to the heat exchanger, the procedure specified by the vehicle’s manufacturer for cold weather starting shall be followed during the entire test period, except that the use of a power or heat source external to the vehicle is not permitted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of all other passenger cars and three-wheeled vehicles,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: during the entire test period, the engine speed shall not exceed 1,500 revolutions per minute in neutral gear or the engine speed and load shall not exceed the speed and load at 40 km/h (25 miles per hour) in the manufacturer’s recommended gear with road load, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: during the first 5 minutes of the test period, the warm-up procedure recommended by the vehicle’s manufacturer for cold weather starting shall be followed and during the last 35 minutes of the test period, the procedure referred to in subparagraph (i) shall be followed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a room air change of 90 times per hour is not required;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the windshield wipers may be used during the test if they are operated without manual assistance;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: one or two windows may be open a total of 25 mm;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the defroster blower may be turned on at any time;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the wind velocity is at any level from 0 to 3 km/h; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the test chamber temperature and the wind velocity shall be measured after the engine has been started, at the forwardmost point of the vehicle or a point 91.4 cm (36 inches) from the base of the windshield, whichever is farther forward, at a level halfway between the top and the bottom of the windshield on the vehicle centreline.

Subsection.Text: In this section,

Definition.Text: areas A, B and C means the areas referred to in Column I of Tables I, II, III and IV to this section when established as shown in Figures 1 and 2 of SAE Recommended Practice J903a Passenger Car Windshield Wiper Systems, (May 1966), using the angles specified in Columns III to VI of the above Tables; (zones A, B et C)

daylight opening means the maximum unobstructed opening through the glazing surface as defined in paragraph 2.3.12 of Section E, Ground Vehicle Practice, SAE Aerospace-Automotive Drawing Standards, (September 1963); (ouverture de jour)

glazing surface reference line means the intersection of the glazing surface and a horizontal plane 635 mm above the seating reference point, as shown in Figure 1 of SAE Recommended Practice J903a (May 1966); (ligne de référence de la surface vitrée)
overall width means the maximum overall body width dimension W116 as defined in Section E, Ground Vehicle Practice, SAE Aerospace-Automotive Drawing Standards, (September 1963); (largeur hors tout)
plan view reference line means,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of vehicles with a bench type front seat, a line parallel to the longitudinal centreline of the vehicle and outboard of the centre of the steering wheel by a distance equal to 0.15 times the difference between one-half the shoulder room dimension and the steering wheel centre offset, as shown in Figure 2 of SAE Recommended Practice J903a, (May 1966); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of vehicles with individual front seats,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a line parallel to the longitudinal centreline of the vehicle which passes through the centre of the driver’s designated seating position, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a line parallel to the longitudinal centreline of the vehicle located so that the geometric centre of the 95 per cent eye range contour is positioned on the longitudinal centreline of the driver’s designated seating position; (ligne de référence longitudinale)

Definition.Text: shoulder room dimension means the front shoulder room dimension W3 as defined in Section E, Ground Vehicle Practice, SAE Aerospace-Automotive Drawing Standards, (September 1963); (espace d’épaules)

95 per cent eye range contour means the 95th percentile tangential cut-off specified in SAE Recommended Practice J941a Passenger Car Driver’s Eye Range, (August 1967). (95 pour cent du contour de portée visuelle)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, the expressions “manikin H-point”, “manikin H-point with seat in rearmost position”, and “H-point” used in an SAE Standard or SAE Recommended Practice mean “seating reference point”.
Subject to subsection (3.1), every vehicle shall have a power-driven windshield wiping system that has at least two frequencies or speeds and that has, irrespective of engine speed and engine load,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: one frequency or speed of at least 45 cycles per minute;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a difference of at least 15 cycles per minute between the highest frequency or speed and one of the lower frequencies or speeds; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the lower frequency or speed referred to in paragraph (b) equal to at least 20 cycles per minute.

Subsection.Text: A three-wheeled vehicle that is equipped with a windshield shall have a windshield wiping system that conforms to the requirements of subsection (3).
Compliance with subsection (3) shall be demonstrated by testing under the conditions specified in sections 4.1.1 and 4.1.2 of SAE Recommended Practice J903a, (May 1966).

In the case of a passenger car or a three-wheeled vehicle, the windshield wiping system, when tested wet in accordance with SAE Recommended Practice J903a (May 1966), shall wipe the percentage of areas A, B and C of the windshield that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is specified in Column II of whichever of Tables I, II, III or IV to this section is applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is within the area bounded by a perimeter line on the glazing surface 25 mm from the edge of the daylight opening.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (7), every vehicle shall have a windshield washing system that meets the requirements of SAE Recommended Practice J942, Passenger Car Windshield Washer Systems (November 1965), except that the words “the effective wipe pattern defined in SAE J903, paragraph 3.1.2” in paragraph 3.1 of SAE Recommended Practice J942 shall be replaced

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a passenger car or a three-wheeled vehicle, by the words “the areas established in accordance with the definition of areas A, B and C in subsection (1) of Canada Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 104”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a multi-purpose passenger vehicle, truck or bus, by the words “the pattern designed by the manufacturer for the windshield wiping system on the exterior surface of the windshield glazing”.

Subsection.Text: A three-wheeled vehicle that is equipped with a windshield shall have a windshield washing system that meets the requirements of subsection (6).

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 135 of this Schedule, every multi-purpose passenger vehicle, truck and bus shall conform to the requirements of Technical Standards Document No. 105, Hydraulic and Electric Brake Systems (TSD 105), as amended from time to time.

An indicator lamp referred to in S5.3 of TSD 105 shall, when activated due to a condition set out in S5.3.1 of TSD 105, display the identification symbol set out in the table to section 101 of this Schedule that corresponds to that condition, but if the vehicle is fitted with a single common indicator lamp, the lamp shall display the identification symbol for a brake system malfunction set out in the table to section 101 of this Schedule.
The statement set out in S5.4.3 of TSD 105 may be replaced by another statement to the same effect.

Every brake hose, brake hose assembly and brake hose end fitting with which a passenger car, multi-purpose passenger vehicle, truck, bus, three-wheeled vehicle, motorcycle, trailer, and trailer converter dolly are equipped shall conform to the requirements of Technical Standards Document No. 106, Brake Hoses (TSD 106), as amended from time to time.

A reference in TSD 106 to a standard published by ASTM that is set out in column 1 of the table to this subsection may be read as a reference to the standard set out opposite that standard in column 2 of the table.
